cn.crowdos.kernel.system.resource

Class Mission

  • java.lang.Object
    • cn.crowdos.kernel.system.resource.Mission

  • public class Mission
extends Object
    Mission maintains the execution of tasks in the system, reporting over task assignment results, task submission order, etc. Whenever a task is assigned, the system changes to generate a Mission object. All the Missions are recorded in the MissionHistory.
    Since:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    loyx
    See Also:
    MissionHistory

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mission

        public Mission(Task task,
               List<Participant> participants)
        The Mission function is a constructor for the Mission class. It takes in two parameters: task and participants, which are both objects of other classes. The function initializes the fields of this class with these parameters, as well as creating new instances of PriorityQueue and ArrayList to be used by this object.
        Parameters:
        task - Set the task of this mission
        participants - Create a new list<participant> submitparticipants

        public void updateSubmit(Participant participant)

      • updateSubmit

        public void updateSubmit(Participant participant,
                         Date submitTime)
                  throws MissionUpdateException
        The updateSubmit function is used to update the submit time of a participant.
        Parameters:
        participant - Identify the participant that is updating their status
        submitTime - Determine the order in which participants submit their work
        Throws:
        MissionUpdateException - MissionUpdateException

      • belongTo

        public boolean belongTo(Task task)
        The belongTo function checks if the task of a given TaskItem is equal to the task of this TaskItem. If they are, it returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.
        Parameters:
        task - Compare the task object to the current task object
        Returns:
        A boolean value

      • involved

        public boolean involved(Participant participant)
        The involved function checks if a participant is involved in the conversation.
        Parameters:
        participant - Check if the participant is already in the participants list
        Returns:
        True if the participant is in the list of participants
